meanings.definition: To feed (someone) again or differently after a period of malnourishment or starvation.
meanings.sent1: After the famine, the villagers started refeeding the hungry children with nutritious meals.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended refeeding the patient slowly to avoid any digestive issues.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he was refeeding the oven with more ingredients than it could handle.
meanings.sent4: The gardeners were refeeding the soil with rich compost to ensure healthy plant growth.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the importance of refeeding the mind with new knowledge every day.

meanings.definition: The act of reintroducing food to someone who has been deprived of it.
meanings.sent1: The refeeding of the rescued animals at the shelter brought joy to the volunteers.
meanings.sent2: During the refeeding process, the patient's progress was closely monitored by the medical team.
meanings.sent3: The refeeding of snacks at the party made everyone rush to the buffet table.
meanings.sent4: The refeeding of nutrients into the soil revived the once wilted plants in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The refeeding of ideas in the brainstorming session led to innovative solutions.
